Interface Overview

The JCE Image Manager interface is designed to be easy to use, and provide the maximum amount of functions within a limited space. Most functions are performed by clicking on the relevant icon.

 Go Up A Directory - 

 Create Folder - Creates a new folder in the current directory with the given folder name.

 Upload File - Opens the Upload Dialog which allows you to select and upload a file from your local machine to the current directory.

 Switch Mode - Switches between the List View and Thumbnail  View display modes.

 Help - Opens this Help dialog.

 Rename - Renames a file or folder. This action can only be perormed on a single file or folder.

 Delete - Deletes a file, files or folder. Only single folders can be deleted, but multiple files can be deleted.

 Paste - Pastes a file or files from the clipboard to the destination directory.

 Copy - Copies a file to the clipboard.

 Cut - As Copy, but when a paste action is performed, the file is moved from the source directory to the destination directory.

 View - Opens the Image in a popup window for viewing.

 Is Thumb - Indicates that the selected image is a thumbnail, or that it's dimensions are equal to or less than that of a thumbnail.

 Create Thumbnail - Creates a thumbnail of the selected file with the given dimensions. If a thumbnail folder does not exist, one will be create in the same directory as the source image.

 Delete Thumbnail - Deletes an images thumbnail. If this operation leaves the thumbnail directory empty, it too will be deleted.
